allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat(auth-service): initial feature specification and checklist

This commit adds the initial specification and quality checklist for the Auth Service feature.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat(book-writing): initial setup for Chapter 1

This commit sets up the initial environment for writing Chapter 1 of the book,
"The Physical AI Lab", by adding the course syllabus reference file.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(gh pr create --title "feat(book-writing): initial setup for Chapter 1" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary
- This PR sets up the initial environment for writing Chapter 1 of the book, "The Physical AI Lab."
- It includes the `course-syllabus.md` as a reference for content generation.

## Test plan
- Verify that the `feat/book-writing-chapter-1` branch is created on the remote.
- Confirm that `references/course-syllabus.md` is present in the new branch.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)")

Bash(gh pr create --title "feat(rag-backend-api): initial implementation of RAG backend with ingestion fixes" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary
- This PR includes the initial implementation of the RAG backend system, encompassing the FastAPI application, the OpenAI Agents SDK-based RAG agent, and the markdown ingestion service.
- It also integrates critical fixes for the ingestion pipeline:
  - Updated `app/services/ingestion.py` to use `AsyncOpenAI` for asynchronous embedding generation.
  - Modified `app/services/ingestion.py` to generate unique IDs for Qdrant `PointStruct`s using SHA256 hashes.
- Dependencies in `pyproject.toml` and `uv.lock` have been updated.

## Test plan
- Ensure Qdrant is running and environment variables (OPENAI_API_KEY, QDRANT_URL, QDRANT_API_KEY) are set.
- Run the FastAPI application (`uvicorn app.main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000`) and verify successful ingestion of book content without errors.
- Use `check_qdrant.py` (a separate script, as provided previously) to confirm the `physical_ai_book` collection exists and contains vectors.
- Test the `/api/chat` endpoint with relevant queries to ensure the RAG agent retrieves and responds correctly based on the ingested content.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)")
